2025-10-09.content:
**M134 release**

The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

* Patched a regression with custom notebook metrics reporting (for example,
  `jupyterlab_kernels` and `docker_status metrics`).
* Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (`dataproc-jupyter-plugin`) to
  version 0.1.92.
* When using Google Cloud CLI commands, the `project` and `region` properties
  are preset.

summary.title: M134 Release Notes
summary.summary: The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes important updates such as a fix for custom notebook metrics reporting and an updated Dataproc JupyterLab plugin. Additionally, Google Cloud CLI commands now have preset 'project' and 'region' properties for improved user experience.

2025-10-01.content:
[Generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages):
You can use [Workforce Identity Federation](https://docs.cloud.google.com/iam/docs/workforce-identity-federation)
with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Workforce Identity Federation lets
you create and manage Vertex AI Workbench instances with credentials
provided by an external identity provider (IdP). For more information, see
[Create an instance with third party credentials](https://docs.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/workbench/instances/create-third-party-instance).

summary.title: Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench
summary.summary: You can now use Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench instances. This feature allows you to manage Vertex AI Workbench instances using credentials from an external identity provider.

2025-09-17.content:
**M133 release**

The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

* Patched an incompatibility with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (`dataproc-jupyter-plugin`) and instances with end-user credentials enabled.

summary.title: M133 Release Notes
summary.summary: The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances resolves an incompatibility issue with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin for instances using end-user credentials.

2025-08-29.content:
**M132 release**

The M132 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

* The new scheduler Jupyter plugin (`scheduler-jupyter-plugin`) is now preinstalled in the Jupyterlab 4 environment, with support for both the Cloud Composer and Vertex AI notebook schedulers.
* Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (`dataproc-jupyter-plugin`) to version 0.1.90.
* Patched bugs related to the managed end user credentials feature (Preview), resolving an incompatibility with listing Dataproc remote kernels.
* Patched a bug that caused instances with disabled proxy access to get stuck in provisioning.
* Removed the archived Debian 11 backports repository, resolving an issue with running `apt update` within the instance.

summary.title: M132 Release
summary.summary: The M132 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances is here, featuring a new Jupyter plugin for scheduling and bug fixes.

2025-08-05.content: [Generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages): You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see [Use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/workbench/instances/reservations).

summary.title: Vertex AI Workbench now supports reservations
summary.summary: You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run.

2025-07-10.content:
**M131 release**

The M131 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

* Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.89.

summary.title: M131 Release Update
summary.summary: The M131 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances features an update to the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.89.

2025-06-26.content:
**M130 release**

The M130 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

* Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.87.
* Added the BigQuery JupyterLab plugin, version 0.0.1.
* The `GOOGLE_CLOUD_REGION` environment variable is now set by default.

summary.title: Vertex AI Workbench M130 release
summary.summary: The M130 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances introduces the BigQuery JupyterLab plugin and updates the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin. Additionally, the GOOGLE_CLOUD_REGION environment variable is now set by default.

2025-06-10.content: Available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages): You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see [Use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/workbench/instances/reservations).

summary.title: Reservations available for Vertex AI Workbench
summary.summary: You can now use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances to ensure your jobs have the necessary resources. This feature is available in Preview and helps you gain a high level of assurance for your resource needs.
